0: Story highlights Jacob Thompson probably has less than a month to live NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He wants people around the world to send him cards for the holiday NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR (CNN) Nine-year-old Jacob Thompson is your average kid. His obsessions include Minecraft and Legos, and he's a huge "Star Wars" fan. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He's also a photographer, singer and comedian, according to his stepmother, Tara Artinyan. And most of all, he really, really loves penguins. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But Jacob has Stage 4 high-risk neuroblastoma, and doctors told his family in early October he probably only had a month to live. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR So they'll celebrate Christmas early this year, and Jacob wants people to celebrate with him by sending him cards, his mother, Michelle Simard told CNN. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He got some cards from this Halloween, and he opened up and saw them and it was like getting a gift. He read it to us and had a big smile his face and his nose scrunched," Jacob's father, Roger Guay, told CNN in a phone interview.
